title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 12 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 12.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12:4, what is the source of the diversities of gifts?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:4 says there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit is the source of these gifts.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 12:3 say about who can call Jesus accursed?
options: No man speaking by the Spirit of God
questions.correctAnswer: No man speaking by the Spirit of God
questions.explanation: According to 1 Corinthians 12:3, no man speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed.

questions.question: Which of the following gifts is mentioned in 1 Corinthians 12:8 as given by the Spirit?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:8 specifically mentions the word of wisdom as a gift given by the Spirit.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 12:27, believers are described as the body of Christ.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:27 states, 'Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.'

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed in 1 Corinthians 12:28 as set in the church by God?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:28 lists apostles, prophets, teachers, miracles, gifts of healing, helps, governments, and diversities of tongues, but not kings.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 12:13: 'For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one _______, whether we be Jews or Gentiles.'
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:13 clearly states that by one Spirit we are baptized into one body.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12:11, who divides the gifts to every man severally as he wills?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:11 explains that the one and the selfsame Spirit works in all and distributes gifts to every man as He wills.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 12:22 says that the more feeble members of the body are unnecessary.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:22 states that those members which seem to be more feeble are necessary, not unnecessary.

questions.question: Which member of the body is used as an example in 1 Corinthians 12:15 to illustrate unity despite differences?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:15 uses the foot as an example saying it cannot say it is not of the body just because it is not the hand.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 12:26 say happens when one member of the body suffers?
options: All the members suffer with it
questions.correctAnswer: All the members suffer with it
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:26 states that when one member suffers, all the members suffer with it.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 12:29, all believers are apostles.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:29 asks rhetorically if all are apostles, implying that not all believers are apostles.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12:7, why is the manifestation of the Spirit given to every man?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:7 states the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the body and its many members according to 1 Corinthians 12:14?
options: The body is not one member, but many
The body is only one member
The body is divided into parts
questions.correctAnswer: The body is not one member, but many
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:14 clearly states that the body is not one member but many.

questions.question: Which gift is mentioned last in the list of gifts in 1 Corinthians 12:10?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:10 ends the list of gifts with the interpretation of tongues.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Corinthians 12:1: 'Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ______.'
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:1 begins with Paul saying he would not have the brethren ignorant concerning spiritual gifts.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is feeling insignificant in church because they do not have a prominent gift. Based on 1 Corinthians 12, what biblical truth would you share about their role?
options: Every member is important and has a unique role in the body of Christ
Only apostles and prophets are important in the church
Those without a gift are not part of the body
Only those with miracles are honored by God
questions.correctAnswer: Every member is important and has a unique role in the body of Christ
questions.explanation: Verses 12:14-27 explain that the body has many members, each necessary and honored by God, emphasizing unity and interdependence in the church body.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 12 teach us about humility when comparing our spiritual gifts with others?
options: We should honor the less honorable members more abundantly
We should boast about the gift we have
We should desire the gifts that seem best to us
We should avoid fellowship with those who have different gifts
questions.correctAnswer: We should honor the less honorable members more abundantly
questions.explanation: Verses 12:22-24 show that God gives more abundant honor to members considered less honorable, teaching humility and mutual respect.

questions.question: A new believer is confused about how spiritual gifts are given. What does 1 Corinthians 12 say about who distributes these gifts?
options: The Holy Spirit distributes gifts individually as He wills
The church leaders decide who gets which gift
Gifts are earned by good works
Each person chooses their own gift
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit distributes gifts individually as He wills
questions.explanation: Verse 12:11 states that the same Spirit works and divides to each one individually as He wills, emphasizing God's sovereignty in gifting.

questions.question: What practical lesson about unity in marriage or family life can be drawn from the analogy of the body in 1 Corinthians 12?
options: Each member has a different function but all work together as one body
Only the strongest family member should lead
Family members should act independently for their own benefit
Family members do not need each other
questions.correctAnswer: Each member has a different function but all work together as one body
questions.explanation: Verses 12:12-20 illustrate how many members form one body, teaching cooperation and valuing each role within family relationships.

questions.question: A church member feels unnecessary because their gift is less visible. Based on 1 Corinthians 12, how should the church view and treat such members?
options: They should be honored more abundantly and cared for
They should be asked to leave
They should be given the least important tasks
questions.correctAnswer: They should be honored more abundantly and cared for
questions.explanation: Verses 12:23-25 teach that members considered less honorable receive more abundant honor and the body should care for one another to prevent division.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 12 instruct believers to respond when another member suffers or is honored?
options: All members suffer with the suffering one and rejoice with the honored one
Ignore the suffering and focus on oneself
Jealously compare themselves to the honored member
questions.correctAnswer: All members suffer with the suffering one and rejoice with the honored one
questions.explanation: Verse 12:26 explains that when one member suffers, all suffer; when one is honored, all rejoice together, showing mutual care and empathy.

questions.question: In the context of evangelism, how does 1 Corinthians 12 describe the unity of believers from different backgrounds?
options: All are baptized by one Spirit into one body, regardless of background
Only Jews are part of the body
Gentiles are excluded from spiritual gifts
Different backgrounds mean separate spiritual bodies
questions.correctAnswer: All are baptized by one Spirit into one body, regardless of background
questions.explanation: Verse 12:13 states that by one Spirit, all believers—Jews or Gentiles, bond or free—are baptized into one body, emphasizing unity in diversity.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 12, no man can say 'Jesus is Lord' except by the Holy Spirit.
questions.explanation: Verse 12:3 clearly states that no one can say 'Jesus is Lord' except by the Holy Ghost, emphasizing the Spirit's role in confession of faith.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 12 teaches that spiritual gifts operate independently and do not function together for the common good.
questions.explanation: Verses 12:4-6 teach that though there are different gifts, administrations, and operations, they all come from the same Spirit, Lord, and God working together for all.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a spiritual gift in 1 Corinthians 12?
questions.explanation: Verses 12:8-10 list gifts such as wisdom, prophecy, tongues, healing, but 'leadership over nations' is not mentioned as a gift in this chapter.

questions.question: A believer is longing for a particular spiritual gift. What guidance does 1 Corinthians 12 give about desiring gifts?
options: Covet earnestly the best gifts, but also seek a more excellent way
Only seek the gifts that are easy to obtain
Ignore the gifts and focus on works
Demand a specific gift from God
questions.correctAnswer: Covet earnestly the best gifts, but also seek a more excellent way
questions.explanation: Verse 12:31 encourages believers to desire the best gifts earnestly but points to a more excellent way, alluding to love as the higher principle.

questions.question: When a believer feels tempted to think their gift is unimportant, what biblical truth from 1 Corinthians 12 would help them persevere?
options: God has placed every member in the body as He pleased, and each is necessary
Only the most visible gifts matter to God
God favors certain gifts over others
Gifts are given based on personal merit
questions.correctAnswer: God has placed every member in the body as He pleased, and each is necessary
questions.explanation: Verse 12:18 teaches that God set every member in the body as it pleased Him, affirming the importance of each believer's gift and role.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to ______ withal.'
questions.explanation: Verse 12:7 states that the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal, meaning to benefit the church and others.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 12 encourage believers to show care in church life?
options: Members should have the same care one for another to prevent division
Each person should focus only on their own gifts
Only elders should care for the members
Care is unnecessary if gifts are present
questions.correctAnswer: Members should have the same care one for another to prevent division
questions.explanation: Verse 12:25 emphasizes that there should be no division in the body, and members should care for one another equally.

questions.question: In a workplace setting, how can the teaching of 1 Corinthians 12 about different operations and administrations guide a believer's attitude toward coworkers with different roles?
options: Respect that different roles and operations come from the same God who works all in all
Only value coworkers with leadership roles
Ignore coworkers whose roles differ from yours
Compete to outshine others in different roles
questions.correctAnswer: Respect that different roles and operations come from the same God who works all in all
questions.explanation: Verses 12:4-6 teach that though there are different gifts and administrations, the same Spirit, Lord, and God work all in all, encouraging respect for diverse roles.

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 12.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12, what is the source of all spiritual gifts?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:4-6 shows that all gifts, administrations, and operations are from the same Spirit, Lord, and God respectively, indicating the unity and origin of spiritual gifts in the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use in 1 Corinthians 12 to explain the diversity and unity of believers?
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor of the body to illustrate how many members with different functions form one unified body, as explained in 1 Corinthians 12:12.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a spiritual gift in 1 Corinthians 12:8-10?
questions.explanation: Baptism is not listed among the spiritual gifts in 1 Corinthians 12:8-10, which include wisdom, knowledge, faith, healing, miracles, prophecy, discerning spirits, tongues, and interpretation of tongues.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the relationship between the eye and the hand in the body analogy?
options: The eye cannot say to the hand, 'I have no need of you'
The hand is superior to the eye
The eye and hand perform the same function
The hand can function without the eye
questions.correctAnswer: The eye cannot say to the hand, 'I have no need of you'
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 12:21, Paul emphasizes interdependence among members of the body, stating the eye cannot say to the hand that it is not needed.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 12, who does Paul say has been baptized into one body by one Spirit?
options: Jews and Gentiles, bond and free
questions.correctAnswer: Jews and Gentiles, bond and free
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:13 states that all believers, whether Jews or Gentiles, bond or free, have been baptized into one body by one Spirit.

questions.question: Which role is mentioned first among those God has set in the church according to 1 Corinthians 12:28?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:28 clearly lists apostles first among the roles God has appointed in the church.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 12, all believers have the gift of healing.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:30 questions if all have the gift of healing and implies that not all possess the same gifts.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the manifestation of the Spirit given to every man, as stated in 1 Corinthians 12:7?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:7 states the manifestation of the Spirit is given to every man to profit withal, meaning for the common good.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 12, how does Paul describe the distribution of spiritual gifts by the Spirit?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:11 says the Spirit works all these gifts, dividing to every man severally as He wills, emphasizing divine sovereignty in distribution.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the function of the 'less honorable' members of the body according to 1 Corinthians 12?
options: They are given more abundant honor
They are excluded from the body
questions.correctAnswer: They are given more abundant honor
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:23-24 explains that the members considered less honorable are treated with more abundant honor to create unity and balance in the body.

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in 1 Corinthians 12:12-27 to teach about the church?
questions.explanation: Paul uses the metaphor of the human body to illustrate the unity and diversity of the church in these verses.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 12:3 define the acknowledgment of Jesus as Lord?
options: It is said by the Holy Ghost
It is taught by the elders
It is written in the Law
questions.correctAnswer: It is said by the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:3 states that no one can say 'Jesus is Lord' except by the Holy Ghost, linking confession of faith to the Spirit’s work.

questions.question: What is the function of 'diversities of tongues' in the list of spiritual gifts in 1 Corinthians 12:10?
options: It is one of the gifts given by the Spirit
It refers to different languages spoken in the synagogue
It is a metaphor for confusion
questions.correctAnswer: It is one of the gifts given by the Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:10 lists 'divers kinds of tongues' as a spiritual gift distributed by the Spirit.

questions.question: Paul's command to 'covet earnestly the best gifts' in 1 Corinthians 12:31 implies what about spiritual gifts?
options: Believers should desire the most useful or edifying gifts
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should desire the most useful or edifying gifts
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:31 encourages believers to earnestly desire the best gifts, indicating that some gifts are more beneficial for the church's edification.

questions.question: What is the historical-cultural significance of Paul addressing Gentiles and their former idolatry in 1 Corinthians 12:2?
options: It contrasts their past ignorance with new spiritual knowledge
It praises their previous religious practices
It encourages them to return to idols
It focuses on Jewish customs only
questions.correctAnswer: It contrasts their past ignorance with new spiritual knowledge
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:2 refers to the Gentiles' former life under dumb idols, highlighting the transformation from paganism to Christian understanding.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 12 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12, what is the source of all spiritual gifts?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:4-11 teaches that the diversities of gifts come from the same Spirit, who distributes them as He wills. This aligns with Old Testament teachings on the Spirit of God granting gifts (Isaiah 11:2) and New Testament affirmations of the Spirit's role (Acts 2:4, Romans 12:6).

questions.question: What does Paul say about someone who declares Jesus 'accursed' while speaking by the Spirit of God?
options: It is a sign of faith
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states that no man speaking by the Spirit of God calls Jesus accursed, emphasizing the Spirit's role in affirming Christ's lordship. This is consistent with Jesus' divine status affirmed in Philippians 2:11 and John 20:31.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the relationship between the body and its members in 1 Corinthians 12?
questions.explanation: Verses 12-20 explain how the body has many members but is one body. This metaphor is echoed in Romans 12:4-5 and Ephesians 4:16, illustrating unity and diversity within the church as Christ's body.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a spiritual gift in 1 Corinthians 12?
questions.explanation: The gifts listed in verses 8-10 and 28 include wisdom, knowledge, faith, healing, miracles, prophecy, discerning spirits, tongues, interpretation, apostles, prophets, teachers, helps, and governments, but not baptism. Baptism is a sacrament, not a spiritual gift (Acts 2:38).

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use to explain the diversity of spiritual gifts and their purpose?
questions.explanation: Paul uses the analogy of the body with many members (verses 12-27) to show how diverse gifts work together in unity. This image is consistent with Jesus' teaching in John 15 about the vine and branches and Old Testament concepts of unity in diversity (Psalm 133).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12, what is the purpose of the manifestation of the Spirit given to every believer?
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for the common good, aligning with the New Testament emphasis on edification and unity (Ephesians 4:12, Romans 14:19).

questions.question: What does Paul say about the distribution of spiritual gifts among believers?
options: The Spirit distributes them as He wills
All believers have the same gifts
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit distributes them as He wills
questions.explanation: Verse 11 explains that the Spirit works all these things, distributing to each one individually as He wills. This affirms God's sovereign role in gifting (Romans 12:6) and rejects merit or inheritance as grounds for gifts.

questions.question: In the analogy of the body, what does Paul say would happen if the whole body were an eye?
questions.explanation: Verse 17 rhetorically asks if the whole body were an eye, where would be the hearing? This illustrates the necessity of diverse functions within the body, paralleled in Ecclesiastes 4:9-12 emphasizing complementarity.

questions.question: What does Paul say about members of the body which seem to be weaker or less honorable?
options: They are necessary and given more abundant honor
They are not part of the body
They are less loved by God
questions.correctAnswer: They are necessary and given more abundant honor
questions.explanation: Verses 22-24 explain that the weaker members are necessary and are given more abundant honor to ensure the body is well tempered. This reflects Christ's teaching about humility and service (Matthew 23:11).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 12, by what are all believers baptized into one body?
questions.explanation: Verse 13 teaches that all believers are baptized by one Spirit into one body, emphasizing unity beyond ethnic and social distinctions. This complements Jesus' promise of the Spirit (John 14:17) and the church's unity (Ephesians 4:4-6).

questions.question: Which order of roles in the church does Paul mention as set by God in 1 Corinthians 12?
options: Apostles, prophets, teachers, miracles, healings, helps, governments, tongues
Prophets, apostles, teachers, healings, miracles, helps, governments, tongues
Teachers, apostles, prophets, miracles, healings, helps, governments, tongues
Apostles, teachers, prophets, miracles, healings, helps, governments, tongues
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles, prophets, teachers, miracles, healings, helps, governments, tongues
questions.explanation: Verse 28 lists these roles in this specific order, showing a divinely appointed structure within the church. This aligns with Ephesians 4:11 where similar roles equip the saints.

questions.question: What attitude toward spiritual gifts does Paul encourage at the end of 1 Corinthians 12?
questions.explanation: Verse 31 encourages believers to desire the best gifts, showing that spiritual gifts are valuable and desirable, consistent with the pursuit of love and edification (1 Corinthians 13).

questions.question: What does Paul say happens when one member of the body suffers or is honored?
options: All members suffer or rejoice with it
questions.correctAnswer: All members suffer or rejoice with it
questions.explanation: Verse 26 explains the solidarity of the body of Christ, where the experiences of one member affect the whole. This reflects the unity taught in Romans 12:15 and Galatians 6:2.

questions.question: How does Paul address potential feelings of inferiority among members of the body who are not apostles, prophets, or teachers?
options: Not all have these gifts, but all are necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Not all have these gifts, but all are necessary
questions.explanation: Verses 29-30 question if all are apostles, prophets, or teachers, implying diversity in gifting and the necessity of all members. This teaches ecclesiological humility and interdependence (Romans 12:4-5).

questions.question: What does Paul say about the hand's relationship to the eye within the body metaphor?
options: The eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee
The hand is superior to the eye
The hand and eye are separate bodies
questions.correctAnswer: The eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee
questions.explanation: Verse 21 underscores mutual dependence within the body, illustrating the unity and necessity of all members, consistent with Jesus' teaching on humility (Mark 9:35).
